definition: to resist (with great difficulty)
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
variant of 強|强[jiang4]
variant of 強|强[qiang3]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
variant of 強|强[qiang2]
surname Qiang
stubborn/unyielding
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
to try hard to suppress one's grief (idiom)

sentences.english: We bit our tongues the entire weekend to keep from telling him where to go!
sentences.chinese: 整个周末我们强忍住未向他下逐客令。

sentences.english: The financial system has been strained, but it has not broken down.
sentences.chinese: 金融系统已经劳其筋骨，但却强忍着不崩溃。

sentences.english: She fought back her tears as she said goodby.
sentences.chinese: 她在道别时强忍住没有哭出来。

sentences.english: He withheld from tears when he heard that.
sentences.chinese: 听到那个消息他强忍住泪水。

sentences.english: He gulped back the furious reply he wanted to make.
sentences.chinese: 他强忍住本想作出的愤怒的回答。

sentences.english: I tried to subdue my fury.
Li Wu body tolerate the pain and the hearts of sadness, absolutely still.
sentences.chinese: 李武强忍身上的剧痛和心中的悲伤，纹丝不动。

sentences.english: I closed my locker door, hung my head low, and fought back a tear.
sentences.chinese: 我关上储物柜的门，低垂着头，强忍住眼泪。

sentences.english: Her anger smothered and she smiled at him.
sentences.chinese: 她强忍住她的忿怒，并且还朝他笑了一笑。

sentences.english: I mopped it up with napkins from the dispenser and tried not to cry.
sentences.chinese: 我强忍住眼泪从纸筒里拿出纸巾来把水擦掉。

sentences.english: I resisted the powerful urge to ask him to play for just one more summer.
sentences.chinese: 我强忍着自己不去要求他跟我再演奏一个夏季。

sentences.english: Winston let out the water and disgustedly removed the clot of human hair that had blocked up the pipe.
sentences.chinese: 温斯顿放掉污水，强忍恶心掏出堵塞水管的一团毛发。

sentences.english: Vidic was forced to come off after 52 minutes of Sunday's game
sentences.chinese: 周日的比赛维迪奇强忍着坚持着踢了五十二分钟比赛。

sentences.english: I gulped back my tears, looking at Yihe in the same sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我强忍住泪水，看着同样悲痛的一禾。

definition: to use all one's willpower (to do sth)/to hang in there
to clench one's teeth/to grind the teeth/gnaw
to make oneself do sth in spite of adversity, pain etc
jaw/mandibular joint
to restrain/to control
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
see 咬緊牙關|咬紧牙关[yao3 jin3 ya2 guan1]
to hold in (usually refers the mouth or eyes)
almost/nearly going to
to not say a word
anger
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
acute pain/sharp pain/twinge/stab/pang
to strive/to make an effort/to exert oneself
can't help it/can't bear it
to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
